quote0.quote: How simple a thing it seems to me that to know ourselves as we are, we must know our mothers names.
quote0.author: Alice Walker

quote1.quote: And so our mothers and grandmothers have, more often than not anonymously, handed on the creative spark, the seed of the flower they themselves never hoped to see: or like a sealed letter they could not plainly read.
quote1.author: Alice WalkerIn Search of Our Mothers' Gardens (p. 240)

quote2.quote: They say that man is mighty, He governs land and sea;He wields a mighty scepterO
quote2.author: William Ross Wallace

quote3.quote: My Mother was the most beautiful woman I ever saw. All I am I owe to my Mother. I attribute all my success in life to the moral, intellectual and physical education I received from her.
quote3.author: George Washington

quote4.quote: Young women especially have something invested in being nice people, and it's only when you have children that you realize you're not a nice person at all, but generally a selfish bully.
quote4.author: Fay Weldon

quote5.quote: Motherhood is the strangest thing, it can be like being one's own Trojan horse.
quote5.author: Rebecca West

quote6.quote: All women become like their mothers. That is their tragedy. No man does. That's his.
quote6.author: Oscar Wilde

quote7.quote: Of all the rights of women, the greatest is to be a mother.
quote7.author: Lin Yutang

quote8.quote: He that would the daughter win must with the mother first begin.
quote8.author: English Proverb

quote9.quote: A mother understands what a child does not say.
quote9.author: Yiddish Proverb

quote10.quote: God couldn't be everywhere, so he created mothers
quote10.author: Yiddish Proverb

quote11.quote: God could not be everywhere and therefore he made mothers
quote11.author: Anon.

quote12.quote: Original Poems for Infant Minds My MotherWho ran to help me when I fell,And would some pretty story tell,Or kiss the place to make it well?My Mother.
quote12.author: Anon.

quote13.quote: For a mother is the only person on earth Who can divide her love among ten children And each child still have all her love.
quote13.author: Anon.

quote14.quote: Heaven is at the feet of Mothers.
quote14.author: Arabic Proverb

quote15.quote: A busy mother makes slothful daughters.
quote15.author: Proverb

quote16.quote: An ounce of mother is worth a pound of clergy.
quote16.author: Proverb

quote17.quote: A mother's heart is always with her children.
quote17.author: Proverb

quote18.quote: Where there is a mother in the home, matters go well.
quote18.author: Amos Bronson Alcott

quote19.quote: What do girls do who haven't any mothers to help them through their troubles?
quote19.author: Louisa May Alcott

quote20.quote: A mother who is really a mother is never free.
quote20.author: Honore de Balzac

quote21.quote: The heart of a mother is a deep abyss at the bottom of which you will always find forgiveness.
quote21.author: Honore de Balzac

quote22.quote: The mother's heart is the child's schoolroom.
quote22.author: Henry Ward Beecher

quote23.quote: Her children arise up, and call her blessed.
quote23.author: BibleProverbs 31: 28

quote24.quote: The best thing that could happen to motherhood already has. Fewer women are going into it.
quote24.author: Victoria Billings

quote25.quote: When a woman is twenty, a child deforms her; when she is thirty, he preserves her; and when forty, he makes her young again.
quote25.author: Leon Blum

quote26.quote: Let France have good mothers, and she will have good sons.
quote26.author: Napoleon Bonaparte

quote27.quote: Women know the way to rear up children (to be just). They know a simple, merry, tender knack of tying sashes, fitting baby-shoes, and stringing pretty words that make no sense. And kissing full sense into empty words.
quote27.author: Elizabeth Barrett Browning

quote28.quote: Women known The way to rear up children (to be just)They know a simple, merry, tender knackOf tying sashes, fitting baby-shoesAnd stringing pretty words that make no sense.And kissing full sense into empty words.
quote28.author: Elizabeth Barrett BrowningAurora Leigh

quote29.quote: Motherhood: All love begins and ends there.
quote29.author: Robert Browning

quote30.quote: Some are kissing mothers and some are scolding mothers, but it is love just the same -- and most mothers kiss and scold together.
quote30.author: Pearl Buck

quote31.quote: A mother is she who can take the place of all others but whose place no one else can take.
quote31.author: Cardinal Mermillod

quote32.quote: Never does one feel oneself so utterly helpless as in trying to speak comfort for great bereavement. I will not try it. Time is the only comforter for the loss of a mother.
quote32.author: Jane Welsh Carlyle

quote33.quote: There are lots of things that you can brush under the carpet about yourself until you're faced with somebody whose needs won't be put off.
quote33.author: Angela Carter

quote34.quote: The kind of power mothers have is enormous. Take the skyline of Istanbul -- enormous breasts, pathetic little willies, a final revenge on Islam. I was so scared I had to crouch in the bottom of the boat when I saw it.
quote34.author: Angela Carter

quote35.quote: Nobody can misunderstand a boy like his own mother. Mothers at present can bring children into the world, but this performance is apt to mark the end of their capacities. They can't even attend to the elementary animal requirements of their offspring. It is quite surprising how many children survive in spite of their mothers.
quote35.author: Norman Douglas

quote36.quote: I believe that always, or almost always, in all childhood and in all the lives that follow them, the mother represents madness. Our mothers always remain the strangest, craziest people we've ever met.
quote36.author: Marguerite Duras

quote37.quote: For that's what a woman, a mother wants -- to teach her children to take an interest in life. She knows it's safer for them to be interested in other people's happiness than to believe in their own.
quote37.author: Marguerite Duras

quote38.quote: The fact that we are all trained to be mothers from infancy on means that we are all trained to devote our lives to men, whether they are our sons or not; that we are all trained to force other women to exemplify the lack of qualities which characterizes the cultural construct of femininity.
quote38.author: Andrea Dworkin

quote39.quote: No culture on earth outside of mid-century suburban America has ever deployed one woman per child without simultaneously assigning her such major productive activities as weaving, farming, gathering, temple maintenance, and tent-building. The reason is that full-time, one-on-one child-raising is not good for women or children.
quote39.author: Barbara Ehrenreich

quote40.quote: Take motherhood: nobody ever thought of putting it on a moral pedestal until some brash feminists pointed out, about a century ago, that the pay is lousy and the career ladder nonexistent.
quote40.author: Barbara Ehrenreich

quote41.quote: Life began with waking up and loving my mother's face.
quote41.author: George Eliot

quote42.quote: A mother's yearning feels the presence of the cherished child even in the degraded man.
quote42.author: George Eliot

quote43.quote: But the mother's yearning, that completest type of the life in another life which is the essence of real human love, feels the presence of the cherished child even in the debased, degraded man.
quote43.author: George Eliot

quote44.quote: It is true that you may occasionally overhear a mother say Children must have their naps, It's mother who knows best. When what she really means by that Is that she needs a rest.
quote44.author: Donna EvlethInspiring Quotations compiled by A M Wells, Jr, 1988

quote45.quote: The lullaby is the spell whereby the mother attempts to transform herself back from an ogre to a saint.
quote45.author: James Fenton

quote46.quote: A mother is not a person to lean on, but a person to make leaning unnecessary.
quote46.author: Dorothy Canfield Fisherquoted in 'O' Magazine, May 2003

quote47.quote: Mother's love is peace. It need not be acquired, it need not be deserved.
quote47.author: Erich Fromm

quote48.quote: RICHER THAN GOLDYou may have tangible wealth untold;Caskets of jewels and coffers of gold.Richer than I you can never be --I had a mother who read to me.
quote48.author: Strickland Gillilan

quote49.quote: The mother as a social servant instead of a home servant will not lack in true mother duty. From her work, loved and honored though it is, she will return to her home life, the child life, with an eager, ceaseless pleasure, cleansed of all the fret and fraction and weariness that so mar it now.
quote49.author: Charlotte Perkins Gilman

quote50.quote: Morality and its victim, the mother -- what a terrible picture! Is there indeed anything more terrible, more criminal, than our glorified sacred function of motherhood?
quote50.author: Emma Goldman

quote51.quote: All that remains to the mother in modern consumer society is the role of scapegoat; psychoanalysis uses huge amounts of money and time to persuade analysis and to foist their problems on to the absent mother, who has no opportunity to utter a word in her own defense. Hostility to the mother in our societies is an index of mental health.
quote51.author: Germaine Greer

quote52.quote: The commonest fallacy among women is that simply having children makes them a mother - which is as absurd as believing that having a piano makes one a musician.
quote52.author: Sydney J. Harris

quote53.quote: The most important thing a father can do for his children is to love their mother.
quote53.author: Theodore Hesburgh

quote54.quote: Youth fades; love droops, the leaves of friendship fall; A mother's secret hope outlives them all.
quote54.author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

quote55.quote: A man never sees all that his mother has been to him until it's too late to let her know he sees it.
quote55.author: William Dean Howells

quote56.quote: And yet of all the home remedies, A good wife and mother is still the best.
quote56.author: Kin Hubbard

quote57.quote: A mother is the truest friend we have, when trials, heavy and sudden, fall upon us; when adversity takes the place of prosperity; when friends who rejoice with us in our sunshine, desert us when troubles thicken around us, still will she cling to us, and endeavor by her kind precepts and counsels to dissipate the clouds of darkness, and cause peace to return to our hearts.
quote57.author: Washington Irving

quote58.quote: M-O-T-H-E-RM is for the million things she gave me,O means only that she's growing old,T is for the tears she shed to save me,H is for her heart of purest gold;E is for her eyes, with love-light shining,R means right, and right she'll always be,Put them all together, they spell MOTHER,A word that means the world to me.
quote58.author: Howard Johnson

quote59.quote: A mother is a person who seeing there are only four pieces of pie for five people, promptly announces she never did care for pie.
quote59.author: Tenneva Jordan

quote60.quote: Whatever else is unsure in this stinking dunghill of a world, a mother's love is not.
quote60.author: James JoyceA Portrait of the Artist as a Young Man, ch. 5, 1916

quote61.quote: The watchful mother tarries nigh, though sleep has closed her infants eyes.
quote61.author: John Keble

quote62.quote: I remember my mother's prayers and they have always followed me. They have clung to me all my life.
quote62.author: Abraham Lincoln

quote63.quote: All that I am, or hope to be, I owe to my angel mother.
quote63.author: Abraham Lincoln

quote64.quote: Few misfortunes can befall a boy which bring worse consequences than to have a really affectionate mother.
quote64.author: W. Somerset Maugham

quote65.quote: The Enemy, who wears her mother's usual face and confidential tone, has access; doubtless stares into her writing case and listens on the phone.
quote65.author: Phyllis Mcginley

quote66.quote: Anyone who doesn't miss the past never had a mother.
quote66.author: Gregory Nunn

quote67.quote: GOD made a wonderful mother, A mother who never grows old;He made her smile of the sunshine,And He molded her heart of pure gold;In her eyes He placed bright shining stars,In her cheeks, fair roses you see;God made a wonderful mother,And He gave that dear mother to me.
quote67.author: Pat O'ReillyA WONDERFUL MOTHER

quote68.quote: Clearly, society has a tremendous stake in insisting on a woman's natural fitness for the career of mother: the alternatives are all too expensive.
quote68.author: Ann Oakley

quote69.quote: Every man must define his identity against his mother. If he does not, he just falls back into her and is swallowed up.
quote69.author: Camille Anna Paglia

quote70.quote: Maternity is on the face of it an unsociable experience. The selfishness that a woman has learned to stifle or to dissemble where she alone is concerned, blooms freely and unashamed on behalf of her offspring.
quote70.author: Emily James Putnam

quote71.quote: A Mother's love is something that no on can explain,It is made of deep devotionand of sacrifice and pain,It is endless and unselfishand enduring come what mayFor nothing can destroy itor take that love away . . .It is patient and forgivingwhen all others are forsaking,And it never fails or falterseven though the heart is breaking . . .It believes beyond believingwhen the world around condemns,And it glows with all the beautyof the rarest, brightest gems . . .It is far beyond defining,it defies all explanation,And it still remains a secretlike the mysteries of creation . . .A many splendoured miracleman cannot understandAnd another wondrous evidenceof God's tender guiding hand.
quote71.author: Helen Steiner RiceA MOTHER'S LOVE

quote72.quote: A mother's love is like an island In life's ocean vast and wide,A peaceful, quiet shelterFrom the restless, rising tide. A mother's love is like a fortressAnd we seek protection thereWhen the waves of tribulationSeem to drown us in despair. A mother's love is a sanctuaryWhere our soul can find sweet restFrom the struggle and the tensionOf life's fast and futile quest. A mother's love is like a towerRising far above the crowd,And her smile is like the sunshineBreaking through a threatening cloud. A mother's love is like a beaconBurning bright with Faith and PrayerAnd through the changing scenes of lifeWe can find a haven there.... For a mother's love is fashionedAfter God's enduring love,It is endless and unfailingLike the love of Him above. For God knew in His great wisdomThat he couldn't be everywhere,So he put His little ChildrenIn a loving mother's care.
quote72.author: Helen Steiner RiceA Mother's Love

quote73.quote: The worker can unionize, go out on strike; mothers are divided from each other in homes, tied to their children by compassionate bonds; our wildcat strikes have most often taken the form of physical or mental breakdown.
quote73.author: Adrienne Rich

quote74.quote: As her sons have seen her: the mother in patriarchy: controlling, erotic, castrating, heart-suffering, guilt-ridden, and guilt-provoking; a marble brow, a huge breast, an avid cave; between her legs snakes, swamp-grass, or teeth; on her lap a helpless infant or a martyred son. She exists for one purpose: to bear and nourish the son.
quote74.author: Adrienne Rich

quote75.quote: Biological possibility and desire are not the same as biological need. Women have childbearing equipment. For them to choose not to use the equipment is no more blocking what is instinctive than it is for a man who, muscles or no, chooses not to be a weightlifter.
quote75.author: Betty Rollin

quote76.quote: Only in America do these peasants, our mothers, get their hair dyed platinum at the age of sixty, and walk up and down Collins Avenue in Florida in pedal pushers and mink stoles -- and with opinions on every subject under the sun. It isn't their fault they were given a gift like speech -- look, if cows could talk, they would say things just as idiotic.
quote76.author: Philip Roth

quote77.quote: There was never a great man who had not a great mother.
quote77.author: Olive Schreiner

quote78.quote: Mothers are the most instinctive philosophers.
quote78.author: Harriet Beecher Stowe

quote79.quote: Mother is the name for God in the lips and hearts of little children.
quote79.author: William Makepeace Thackeray

quote80.quote: My mother had a great deal of trouble with me, but I think she enjoyed it.
quote80.author: Mark Twain

quote81.quote: A Freudian slip is when you say one thing but mean your mother.
quote81.author: Source Unknown

quote82.quote: Men never think, at least seldom think, what a hard task it is for us women to go through this very often. God's will be done, and if He decrees that we are to have a great number of children why we must try to bring them up as useful and exemplary members of society.
quote82.author: Queen Victoria
